tf.keras.layers is the preferred high-level layers API for Tensorflow going forward. You're right, for historical reasons tf.layers still allows for reuse with tf.variable_scopes, but Keras layers don't as of 1.9.0 and I don't expect they will going forward.

Some roadmap decisions are still being made, most of the updates for these types of things are sent through our developer mailing lists, you can check out the link to subscribe

Hope that helps!

body:
```tf.keras.layers``` is the preferred high-level layers API for Tensorflow going forward. You're right, for historical reasons ```tf.layers``` still allows for reuse with ```tf.variable_scopes```, but Keras layers don't as of 1.9.0 and I don't expect they will going forward.

Some roadmap decisions are still being made, most of the updates for these types of things are sent through our [developer mailing lists](https://www.tensorflow.org/community/lists), you can check out the link to subscribe

Hope that helps!
